byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from The Hague.

abstract: Ivory Coast is divided over legacy of former president, Laurent Gbagbo, ahead of his trial for crimes against humanity at International Criminal Court in The Hague; supporters assert current president, Alassane Ouattara, should also be held accountable; trial is crucial test for court, which has had mixed success in bringing high-profile offenders to justice.

headline.print_headline: Trial of Ivory Coast’s Ex-President Will Test International Criminal Court
headline.main: Trial of Ivory Coast’s Laurent Gbagbo Will Test International Criminal Court

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The former leader of Ivory Coast will be the first ex-president to be tried by the court when it opens on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The former leader of Ivory Coast will be the first ex-president to be tried by the court when it opens on Thursday.
